Generate 25 high-quality flashcards for the topic 'Right to Audit Clauses' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Information System Lifecycle > Acquisition and Procurement > Contract Security Requirements > Right to Audit Clauses). Incorporate these elements: - Learning Objectives: [paste full list from above] - Active Learning: Design cards to prepare for discussion (trade-offs), peer teaching (role-play elements), problem-solving (SolarWinds scenarios). - Scaffolding Layers: [paste full layers]; ensure even coverage. - Prior Knowledge: SLAs, vendor contracts, third-party risk. - Big Picture: Critical for supply chain security (e.g., SolarWinds), aligning with NIST frameworks. - Sources: NIST SP 800-53 (AU-06, CA-02, SI-04), NIST SP 800-161, FISCAM, SOC 2. - Common Misconceptions: Audit rights only for cloud; self-reported audits sufficient; unlimited access; SOC 2 eliminates need. - Research Context: Clauses grant client audit rights over provider security; covers self/third-party/on-site audits for compliance. Follow the exact flashcard schema: Each card: {"front": "question", "back": {"answer": "...", "distractors": ["d1", "d2", "d3"], "explanation": "detailed...", "bloom_level": "Remember", "scaffolding_layer": 1, "references": ["NIST SP 800-53"]}} Use distractor protocol strictly. Vary question types for active learning (MCQ 50%, cloze 20%, short answer 15%, scenario 15%). Ensure university-level pedagogy: scaffolded, Bloom's progression, misconception correction. Output ONLY a pure JSON array of 25 flashcards. No markdown, no extra text, no explanations outside cards.
